topic.title: New Templar Order
topic.body:
So, I'm doing a bit of research as a side project into what the templars have become. I'm already aware of the organisations such as OSMTH, OSMTJ and this mystery site; https:www.knightstemplarorder.com/ . Whether this site is some elaborate scam or a troll I can't tell, mainly because there's elements of truth in the site too, which also reinforces the scam theory, but also claims to have a membership and works discretely. The entire site is just a confusing mess of ideas and lorem ipsum, and I'm heavily inclined to believe that OSMTH isn't as innocent as they appear to be. 

In particular however, there is one term of the order that strikes me; 
>The Order shall not raise any standing army with the intention of conventional warfare
(which has many, many loopholes)
And according to their site, they both despise modern (and traditional) Islamism yet preach against racism, and apparently is doing "aid work in Iraq." 

Furthermore, there is the claims I've been reading (forgot sources) that the templars were involved in conflicts during WW1 and 2 to defend Europe, (along with names I can't remember), meaning that they were operational after decomissioning, and in 1969 they were recognised by the UN and Switzerland as an official NGO. I believe this was on their website or one similar, but I will update if I find it again.

Any help would be appreciated.

topic.title: what happened to h3?
topic.body: I haven't been online in like 2 weeks (excluding yesterday) and it seems like he's just dissapeared. I miss the guy already, he had interesting threads.

1560820518_13Azsbvu9LH6rFLn5dUE7DEuRTQ59.body: Oh and furthermore, I'm also intrigued by the level of security on their site; no open ports, traffic is relayed through at least 20 different hops, and there's no MAC address and the weird IP of 67.255.255.187.
Another stupid update because I don't think before I post, the IP comes from Maine.

Alright, I've looked into this a bit more, looking at the deep web for answers too, including some old archives. Solid evidence? Still null. I've also took a quick look at the freemasons and that's a whole other conspiracy I don't think I can take on just yet. 
I've also investigated the site further and found their store, which brings up 2 numbers, both not listed with any company (I ran with some OSINT tools). 
Also does this mean I'll have to place together the history of the templars myself since a lot of sources seem to be unreliable? Hell, I don't even know if I'm doing this right.
In that case I suppose it's time to become a historian. Thanks for the advice, it's helped a lot and I'll be sure to be thorough. Any other references you can recommend? Anything's a help

My search so far has gone without reward, I don't think there's much point trying to find something that doesn't want to be found. At least it means they exist and we just have to wait for some leaked files or smth to reveal their existence.

1560807628_1HiSNH8Uh5LSRjqxtrZrBUEquny9D.body:
does your school have a net security team? or did they just lazily block DNS requests and known tor connections. If they're incompotent, you can just use some free barely known vpn service to circumvent it and use tor bridges to make it less obvious, and/or change your MAC address to one of the school admin's (which shouldn't be too hard if you do a scan the LAN (scan the LAN, heh). 
Also I tested it on Wireshark, and all packets relating to communicating with zeronet turned out encrypted so you're good.

1561066486_1HiSNH8Uh5LSRjqxtrZrBUEquny9D.body: Learn to host your own VPN and use whonix. Tails has a number of vulnrabilites that I can't remember off the top of my head, but the general idea is to host everything yourself. That's the only way you can trust something these days. All VPN companies are a fraud.

1563919186_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body:
Protonmail was cucked from the start; not revealing their source code for some soykafty reason should've been raising red flags since conception. I've also had the same issue with tutanoa, and their terrible customer support didn't help in the slightest either. 
Yandex is just russian botnet, as I'm sure you're aware. I'm sure they won't care about a foreigner as long as you don't plan on overthrowing them, so go right ahead. Cock.li + PGP encryption is your safest bet at this point. Mailbox & posteo also should be fine; I think you can pay through bitcoin on one of them.

1564798399_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc3.body: It may seem that our efforts to maintain rights is a futile one I do agree, and hell the botnet sure does look tempting sometimes. We many never be able to fully defeat censorship even if we did know the source but we can sure as hell try.

1568379812_14APsrL3Vnc8mCdWoXwHh3HM7pzeU.body: Reminder that IQ is a meme way of discerning intelligence and it shouldn't be used as a metric for anything scientific

> [reichardnixon](#comment_14_16NfWw2hgzGaVcQs35UJySKMf4YP9kZFbr): Yet they use it to determine SSDI benefits and a lot of other programs.  So whats your fucking point?

Because government will use IQ as a metric in such programs as you mentioned to determine who should and shouldn't receive aid. All in the name of bias and of course, saving money. Same way the US still uses lie detectors as a means of ruling a verdict in a court of law despite lie detectors being complete pieces of shit; you can literally fool them by keeping a steady heartrate, that's how some of the most infamous serial killers of the US passed the test, and how scientists thought plants had emotions, but I'm getting sidetracked.

TL;dr start asking *why* they use such metrics in these matters instead of using the fact they use obsolete methods as a justification for your retarded opinions.
(I suck at formulating my points but hopefully I made sense).

> [kidcourageous](#comment_252_1aaGBN84Cc8VE7iocUxPXiRVhx9qSfXw6): Bruh. Plants do have emotions. Put your hand on a tree sometime and tell me you don't feel the soul of the earth itself flowing through you.
Damn. You're right. Guess niggers really are inferior after all.

1566570350_1Dssbq2y2JDD14aojGG9RX3d5EPpw.body:
I'd have to agree on this in all honesty, but only to a certain extent. 

Firstly, yes; in the past we used religion to explain away concepts we had no scientific understanding of, i.e; how the sun rises and sets every day, or how storms are made. The only thing we haven't explained away is the afterlife and it's for that reason that I believe there may be a scientific explanation to life after biological death that we have not either discovered or are aware of. It's also for that reason why I do believe humans will conquer death one day, but I'm getting sidetracked. 

Secondly, the reason why people see themselves as having such a personal relationship with God is because it's a dynamic relationship with the self; the ego. It's why theists say they have the same opinions, intuitions etc as the theist. The theist *is* God, in a sense. What is really happening when they say 'God helps them in life' is really just them helping themselves but devoting that help to an external power. But of course they'll almost never accept that, because (mainly but not limited to) Christianity teaches its followers to be weak and feeble to be 'good.' 

Furthermore, people who often believe in God do so in fear. The most common belief is that the believers think that God is a monster, and that all he wants is people to worship him for days and years on end. The theist thinks that living in fear of a powerful being for a reward when they die is a good thing: that their benevolent creator has no integrity and would torture people who don't believe in him. They *worship* someone that tortures people out of love because they think they don't have a choice and they refuse to believe anything different. Why? Again, out of fear. I do find theists who think that are some of the most insulting people for this reason. 
(I should also add that I don't hate every single theist that would be retarded)

I can go on forever how people use God to justify their actions, how God can be used to justify murder etc, how religions was used to influence people politically especially in ancient times, but that's not the point on why I'm writing this. (I actually have no idea on why I'm writing this, probably as revision on what my opinions are because I never care enough to remember them).

I'm also going to add that we shouldn't stop people believing in God or criminalize it, since that wouldn't solve anything. Best we should do is continue advancements in science to just make religion obsolete, but until then, leave the people to believe what they want until then. So many people would rather want to fight their perceived enemy rather than advance their own knowledge to beat the opposition in the most efficient way possible. I honestly think that people don't want to really 'beat' their enemy, just shout them down as a means of feeling good about themselves. 

Anyway that's my essay done, hopefully I made sense. I'll probably come back in 5 days time and reword everything I said.
